description.narrative: In this action research project, situation analysis of early child marriages, challenges and power dynamics within the household will be researched. It would be significant to explore that how it influence the decision making processes within the family.While focusing and exploring the relation between institution of the marriage, marriage practices, power relations, and gender discourses along with religious, legal and socio-cultural practices that consequently reinforce early age marriages of individuals of the proposeddistricts as case studies would be complemented with academic insights. Qualitative and quantitative research methods will be used to investigate the issue. Literature review on the subject will be conducted along with review of legislation on child marriage. Following quantitative and qualitative research techniques will be employed to conduct the research. The FGDS, In-depth interviews and Survey will be employed to get the data. For the survey, households will be selected through random sampling. In order to conduct the semi-structured interviews, purposive sampling will be used to select the interviewees. The review of implementation gaps; a mapping exercise with key stakeholders in provinces where early marriages act is in placewould be done through discussion and FGDs with the participants. The proposed research study will be identifying the gaps in implementation and would be suggesting the possible recommendations for the policy makers and the law enforcing agencies in the aforementioned district and also at national level. This project would be an Endeavour between academia and development sector in exploring one of the critical social issue in Pakistan. Regional context as a point of reference would assist in constructing/deconstructing and analyzing prevalent narratives and discourses about the issue. However, the most interesting aspect of the project will be the collaboration of academia and development sector. Howthese two sectors, employing their expertise, skills, knowledge, methods, would produce significant research output.

participating-org.narrative: Centre of Excellence in Gender Stud Quaid-i-Azam University Islamabad

The Centre of Excellence has been imparting valuable knowledge since its inception. As one of the pioneering institute, it has produced critical mass of students who are working in different sectors. Working with the issue of gender and women since many years through teaching and research, the Centre will be adding value to the project through its knowledge and research expertise. The Centre is contributing to create gender consciousness, gender knowledge and gender skills in through the country. The process of social change has already been initiated in the classrooms of gender studies where students are encourage to question the androcentric knowledge and challenge the patriarchal mindset of the state and the society. The students of gender studies are the change agents who arecontributing in the field of development. They are integrating gender perspective in their work that will lead to gender responsivegovernance and higher economic efficiency. The recognition of multiple identities of women and the legitimacy of their productive roles created through gender scholarship will fully integrate women in the social and economic development of the country. The Centrehas a capacity of creation of gender knowledge and has provided guidance and policy not only private but also public sector efectively. As a premier academic institute on Gender and Women studies, it has been imparting knowledge and critical discourses about issues that are considered taboo in society. Through inclusion of critical thinking methods, active engagement at all levels, the Centre is able to produce knowledge, informed, enlightened individuals. While academics, learning, knowledge and research are hallmarks of this Centre, it has been engaged in holding training, seminars and conferences of both regional and international scale on issues of gender.
